Black tries to make me move my queen, but I have a better idea.
Qe5 .  This either gives a queen trade after 6 ...Qe7, gives me the pawn after 6 ...Ne7, or gives me a pawn (and possibly a rook) after 6 ...Be7? 7.Qxg7.
Black plays smart and chooses to block with the knight.
I gladly take the pawn, but wary for the discovered attack on the queen if the knight moves.
Sure enough, there's the attack.
So I move my queen back.
I play Be2, hoping to castle on my next turn to avoid any f2 attacks.  I also want to play Bb5, to pin the pawn and trap the black bishop and thus also trap the queenside rook.
